message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and history suggest diabetic neuropathy, which can cause burning pain and numbness. Nortriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant that is effective for neuropathic pain, and can also help with depression and anxiety, which are common comorbidities in patients with diabetic neuropathy. Morphine and tramadol are opioid medications that are not typically used as first-line therapy for neuropathic pain. Topiramate, an anticonvulsant medication, can be used for neuropathic pain, but it is not the best option for this patient as it can cause cognitive impairment and has a high incidence of adverse effects.
